subject: Re: CIRCA94 x Reicom - Site Breaking + Fix Quote Request
preview: All good.  We're here to help when time is right.

full_threads.body:
All good.

We're here to help when time is right.

Hey Andy,

Thanks for reaching out - unfortunately the client isn't prepared to spend that much, appreciate you checking in though and we'll hopefully work together on the next one!

Thanks,

Dimitri

Dimitri Petrou

Managing Director

32 York Street, Sydney NSW 2000

+61 414 512 345

circa94.com.au

Hi Dimitri,

How did it go and can we be helpful with next steps?

Hey Andy,

Thanks for sending through - leave it with me and I'll let you know!

Thanks,

Dimitri

Hi Dimitri,

We could do the Hosting Only for $45 a month or $450 annually, with the overages for the site fixes when we review (we can keep this below $1000 if helpful as guarantee).
https://wolfiq.com.au/pointdot-hosting-plans/

The care plans are $139 per month which include ongoing support and we could cover the fixes as part of the onboarding.
https://wolfiq.com.au/care-plans/

Thanks,
Andy

Hey Andy,

Thanks for this - I'd prefer to keep hosting where it is but if it's needed can definitely do so (provided there's not a lot of downtime on the client side).

Could you please me know how much we're looking at in total so I can weigh it up/pitch to the client?

Thanks,

Dimitri

Dimitri Petrou

Managing Director

32 York Street, Sydney NSW 2000

+61 414 512 345

Hi Dimitri,

We had a closer look and we don't think the issue is with the site itself, but could be the caching plugin is causing the site to break.

There are quite a few updates as well with the plugins which we could update once it's on our server and provide a quote to fix.

Should we migrate them over?

Thanks,
Andy

Hey Andy,

Thanks for sending through - if possible could you please quote me direct on a rough ballpark, will be paying on behalf of the client for this one!

Thanks,

Dimitri

Okay - leave with me. I'll contact them.

@heath @andy

I'm currently reviewing the site.
I don't there is an issue with site itself, it could be the caching plugin is causing the site to break.
Although there are a few updates as well with the plugins which we could update once its on our server.

—-
I'm not sure the process for this, I'm assuming we ask to them sign a careplan first and we will do the migration.

On Mon, Mar 17, 2025 at 10:17 AM Dimitri Petrou <info@circa94.com.au> wrote:
Hey Heath,

Hope you've been well!

We've got a site that keeps breaking - https://reicom.com.au/, assuming it's the auto-updates but have switched them all off and it keeps happening.

Are you able to investigate and provide a quote on fixing this issue for us once and for all?


Thanks,

Dimitri
